page.title: 01L.MARNEY,L.BRETON,ABBERTON
page.content:
The area is mainly arable farmland with practically no services for the community. There are two small general stores, two garages and two pubs. Most of the inhabitants go out of the area to work. Although there are large farms, very few people are employed on the land, because farming is highly mechanised.
The area includes the villages of {Layer Marney}and{Layer Breton}and the western reaches of{Abberton reservoir. Layer Marney is a scattered community, whilst housing in Layer Breton is more clustered. Personal transport is almost a necessity and children have to leave the villages to go to school.
